Pawtucket.Woonasquatucket River:
The Woonasquatucket River (pronounced , Algonquian for "where the salt water ends") is a river in the U.S. state of Rhode Island. It flows approximately 15.8 miles (25.4 km) and drains a watershed of 130 km2 (50 sq mi).
Together with the Blackstone River to the north, the Woonasquatucket was designated an American Heritage River in 1998.
